main event: A circular yellow and red light was observed in Hebron, Newfoundland on July 7, 1954.
interesting points: The light slowly moved from south to northwest, disappearing through haze and reappearing.,The observation lasted for 5 hours.,Initial evaluations concluded it was unidentifiable.,Reports suggested it could possibly be a balloon or aircraft.,Witness reported the object had a solid appearance with red below and yellow above.
witness description: A reliable radio missionary who observed the light in the sky.
